title: Nicole Scherzinger goes underwear free in risqué sheer silver dress to party the night away following BRITs
text:

Nicole Scherzinger was rocking two seriously fierce looks for the Brit Awards and after parties on Wednesday. 
The singer, 38, changed out of her red studded blazer and boots combo and slipped into a sheer number for the Universal Music event hosted by Soho House and Bacardi Rum. 
Not feeling shy, Nicole went underwear free in the long crochet design, which perfectly clung to her curves and highlighted her impressive frame. 
The sexy dress was nipped in at the waist and featured a low back. 
The X Factor beauty kept her hair in the same crimped style from earlier and changed into cream heels. Nicole Scherzinger attends the Universal Music BRIT Awards After-Party (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Nicole Scherzinger attends the Universal Music BRIT Awards After-Party (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Katy Perry attends the Universal Music BRIT Awards After-Party (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
Nicole was joined by the likes of Katy Perry, Pixie Lott, Naughty Boy and Jamie Callum at the party. 
Meanwhile, during the awards ceremony, Nicole joined Simon Cowell on stage to hand out the award for Best British Video. 
However, the pair ran into a spot of trouble when the music mogul seemed to be incredibly unrehearsed and left the former Pussycat Doll to do most of the talking. Read More Pixie Lott attends the Universal Music BRIT Awards After-Party (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Katy Perry and Nick Grimshaw attend the Universal Music BRIT Awards After-Party (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Nicole Scherzinger attends the Universal Music BRIT Awards After-Party (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Read More David Bowie is biggest winner at BRIT Awards 2017, as Little Mix, Adele and One Direction also pick up prizes 
When she asked him what was next, an obviously baffled-looking Simon admitted that he had no idea what he was doing. 
He was happy in the end though, when he revealed that One Direction star Liam Payne won the award. 
But to make matters worse, all of the stars were plunged into darkness in the middle of the singer's speech.
